page.title: 08DESCRIPTION OF A LOCAL FARM
page.content:
{Bank Top Farm
The major farm in the area is owned by I.C.I. and has been since 1944. It takes up 750 acres of farmland and 1000 acres of woodland. Four men are employed and a full time secretary. Each labourer has a different respons- -ibility e.g.looking after the cattle. The farm contains 1200 sheep,1900 lambs and 200 cows.The main crops are wheat, barley, oilseed rape and grass. Trees are grown for the dual purpose of paper making and as a wind break.On the land combine harvesters and tractors are used.I.C.I. uses the farm to make money and show customers of the agricultural division the best way to use I.C.I. products.The manager envisages the farm concentrating less on crops and more on meat production.
